contentrichtext.text: {{distinguish|Kingsway tramway subway}} {{Use British English|date=July 2012}} {{Infobox tunnel |name = Kingsway Tunnel |image = Liverpool_Entrance_to_the_Kingsway_Tunnel.jpg |caption = The Liverpool Entrance of the Kingsway Tunnel |route = Kingsway Tunnel |location = [[Merseyside]], England |coordinates = |status = Active |start = [[Liverpool]], [[Merseyside]] |end = [[Wallasey]], Merseyside |open = 24 June 1971 |close = |owner = [[Merseyside Passenger Transport Executive|Merseytravel]] |operator = |traffic = Automotive |character = |construction = 1966-1971 |speed = |lanes = 4 (2 in eastbound, 2 westbound) |hielevation = |lowelevation= |height = |grade = |}} The '''Kingsway Tunnel''' is a road [[tunnel]] under the [[River Mersey]] in [[Merseyside]], northwest England, and runs between [[Liverpool]] and [[Wallasey]]. It is one and half miles (2.4 km) long and is often called the '''Wallasey Tunnel''' to distinguish it from the older [[Queensway Tunnel]] which runs between [[Liverpool]] and [[Birkenhead]]. [[File:Benkid77 Kingsway Tunnel Approach Road 2 090809.JPG|left|thumb|The Wallasey entrance to the tunnel showing toll booths and the Liverpool skyline]] [[File:Mersey Tunnel Ventilation Shaft - geograph.org.uk - 76945.jpg|thumb|left|Kingsway Tunnel Ventilation Shaft]] The tunnel was constructed over a five-year period by [[Edmund Nuttall]],<ref>[http://jisc.iceknowledge.com/ArticleView.aspx?doi=10.1680/iicep.1972.5829 ICE Virtual Tour]</ref> after the Queensway Tunnel became unable to cope with modern volumes of traffic. It was opened in June 1971 by [[Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom|Queen Elizabeth II]] and consists of twin tubes, each having two {{convert|12|ft|m|abbr=on}} wide lanes. The entrance to the Kingsway Tunnel is used as the basis of a tunnel entrance in the video game [[Grand Theft Auto III]] — during the 1990s, several members of the game's development team had worked for the Merseyside-based development company [[Psygnosis]].{{Citation needed|date=April 2011}} The present fee for a single car journey through the tunnel is £1.60,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.merseytunnels.co.uk/nossl/html/fees.php| title=Mersey Tunnels: Tolls, Fees and Charges}}</ref> payable at the Wallasey end of the tunnel for vehicles travelling in either direction. In a study following the fire in the [[Mont Blanc Tunnel]] in 1999, inspectors from the [[European Union]] rated the Kingsway Tunnel as "good", one of only eight to receive that rating in Europe. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.merseytunnels.co.uk/ Official website of the Mersey Tunnels] {{River item box |River = [[River Mersey]] |upstream = [[Queensway Tunnel]] |upsub = |downstream = None |downsub = |type = crossing |location = }} {{Liverpool B&S}} {{coord|53.413|-3.010|region:GB_type:landmark_scale:5000_source:Google|display=title}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2011}} [[Category:Transport in Liverpool]] [[Category:Transport in Merseyside]] [[Category:Toll tunnels in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Road tunnels in England]] [[Category:Tunnels completed in 1971]]
